intro: Tithymalus nodiflorus, commonly known as the clustered tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, often with a distinctive central disc. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its compact growth form. Tithymalus nodiflorus is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
